 B&K 2245 sound level meter is a task-tailored, class 1 measurement solution.  This sound level meter platform houses the solution that gets your job done faster and easier.

query: I need a solution that complies with noise regulations and does automated reports.

results.window:
Accurate noise measurement, analysis and reporting has never been more simple.

 This sound level meter platform houses the solution that gets your job done faster and easier.  Controlled via smart-device apps tailored to your task, get your work done with confidence.

 This solution is all you need to easily conduct and report on environmental noise surveys to ensure regulations compliance and investigate noise complaints.

 This SLM-based survey solution simplifies your job of ensuring standards compliance and employee safety, including the data for selecting hearing protection.

 This sound level meter-based product noise measurement solution combines ease of use with reliable, valid data.  Controlled via smart-device apps tailored to your product noise measurement task, B&K 2245 with Product Noise Partner gets the job done.
results.original_text: This solution is all you need to easily conduct and report on environmental noise surveys to ensure regulations compliance and investigate noise complaints.

results.window:
Product: Enviro Noise Partner
URL: https://www.hbkworld.com/en/products/instruments/handheld/sound-level-meters/type-2245/2245-enviro-noise
================================================================================

This solution is all you need to easily conduct and report on environmental noise surveys to ensure regulations compliance and investigate noise complaints.

 Together with an B&K 2245 sound level meter, Enviro Noise Partner is a complete, focused toolset for measuring and reporting on environmental noise concerns.  With an Enviro Noise Partner license installed, your sound level meter can acquire a wide range of broadband parameters including statistics, provide 1/1- or 1/3-octave band frequency analysis, and conduct logging down to 1 s intervals.  These capabilities ensure that you get the right data for your job to do.

query: Which solution should I use to measure noise levels in a factory floor?

results.window:
For these reasons, the names and descriptions should be meaningful and unique within
a single project.  Consider creating a naming convention to create unique, relevant names with minimal effort.
 Another option is to use the room numbers defined by the architect, if possible.
 l Floor/Level: The storey of the building in which the room lies.
 l Volume: The volume of the room.
 You can enter a single calculated value, or you can enter the three dimensions of the room separated by spaces.
 l Reuse measurements from: The room from which to reuse measurements.
results.original_text: l Floor/Level: The storey of the building in which the room lies.

metadata.window:
For these reasons, the names and descriptions should be meaningful and unique within
a single project.  Consider creating a naming convention to create unique, relevant names with minimal effort.
 Another option is to use the room numbers defined by the architect, if possible.
 l Floor/Level: The storey of the building in which the room lies.
 l Volume: The volume of the room.
 You can enter a single calculated value, or you can enter the three dimensions of the room separated by spaces.

metadata.original_text: l Floor/Level: The storey of the building in which the room lies.

results.window:
Ideally, the building is
essentially finished, with all doors and windows installed, but unfurnished.  Ideally, electrical work is complete and elec-
tricity is supplied to the building.  Work at the building should be stopped when measuring.  Soft floor coverings, unless a
permanent installation, should not be installed.
 It is very hard to get a good average of low-frequency levels in small rooms.  For this reason, some standards (such as
ISO 16283) include measurement procedures which are used to adjust low-frequency bands in sound insulation cal-
culations.  For ISO 16283, the procedures are for measurements below 100 Hz where the source or receiving room is
Building Acoustics Partner includes an option to extend the lower limit of the frequency range down to 20 Hz.
results.original_text:
Soft floor coverings, unless a
permanent installation, should not be installed.

metadata.window:
Ideally, the building is

tricity is supplied to the building.  Work at the building should be stopped when measuring.  Soft floor coverings, unless a
permanent installation, should not be installed.
 It is very hard to get a good average of low-frequency levels in small rooms.  For this reason, some standards (such as
ISO 16283) include measurement procedures which are used to adjust low-frequency bands in sound insulation cal-
culations.  For ISO 16283, the procedures are for measurements below 100 Hz where the source or receiving room is
Building Acoustics Partner includes an option to extend the lower limit of the frequency range down to 20 Hz.
metadata.original_text:
Soft floor coverings, unless a
permanent installation, should not be installed.

query: What solution should I use to see if a construction site follows the noise regulations?

results.window:
You may want to reuse 
some of your earlier measurements (like a T2 spectrum known 
from a similar receiving room), to save time.  This is also possible, 
by using a reuse facility in the Explorer display.
 The calculations use a reference curve for frequency weighting of 
the sound reduction spectrum, resulting in a single number like 
R'w = 52 dB (the weighted field sound reduction index according 
to the ISO 140-4).  This means that you will know on site whether 
your construction under test fulfils the minimum requirements of 
the local building regulations. 
 Fig.  9  Left: With the required data measured, final results are shown, including the reference curve.  For some results, the volume of the receiving room and the area of the 
partition must be entered; Right: Example of the final results
Other Tasks
Facade Sound Insulation
Facade sound insulation is a variant of airborne sound insulation, 
with its own standards.
results.original_text:
This means that you will know on site whether 
your construction under test fulfils the minimum requirements of 
the local building regulations.

results.window:
2.  Attach the output cable to the instrument.
 For HBK 2255, the Timer settings group of settings allows you to set up the instrument to switch on and make a meas-
urement at a specific time on a specific day.  This allows you to make measurements without being present, which is use-
ful for long-term environmental monitoring.  The timer functionality requires the BZ-7450 licence to be installed and
Menu location: System settings > Timer settings
How to set up a timer on the instrument
There are 9 timers on the instrument, numbered from 01 to 09.  Each timer can be set for one specific time, and applied
to one or more days of the week.
 1.

l Reject the measurement to remeasure the position automatically.
 The Overview page in the mobile app gives you a test-level view of your data.  The page helps you to keep track of meas-
urements, to visualise the measurement data, and to evaluate the quality of each measurement.  Use the page to make
sure you have the data you need to complete your report before you leave the site.
 l See which positions have been measured and which positions have not been measured.
 l See the range of position averages in a room (sound insulation tests).
 l View position and room averages in the same graph (sound insulation tests).

How to set up a timer on the instrument
There are 9 timers on the instrument, numbered from 01 to 09.  Each timer can be set for one specific time, and applied
to one or more days of the week.
 1.
metadata.original_text:
This allows you to make measurements without being present, which is use-
ful for long-term environmental monitoring.

query: Which solution should I use to measure a building design?

results.window:
Sound insulation tests can be performed on new buildings or on renovations of existing buildings.  Ideally, the building is
essentially finished, with all doors and windows installed, but unfurnished.  Ideally, electrical work is complete and elec-
tricity is supplied to the building.  Work at the building should be stopped when measuring.  Soft floor coverings, unless a
permanent installation, should not be installed.
 It is very hard to get a good average of low-frequency levels in small rooms.  For this reason, some standards (such as
ISO 16283) include measurement procedures which are used to adjust low-frequency bands in sound insulation cal-
culations.
results.original_text: Work at the building should be stopped when measuring.

metadata.window:
Sound insulation tests can be performed on new buildings or on renovations of existing buildings.  Ideally, the building is
essentially finished, with all doors and windows installed, but unfurnished.  Ideally, electrical work is complete and elec-
tricity is supplied to the building.  Work at the building should be stopped when measuring.  Soft floor coverings, unless a
permanent installation, should not be installed.
 It is very hard to get a good average of low-frequency levels in small rooms.  For this reason, some standards (such as
ISO 16283) include measurement procedures which are used to adjust low-frequency bands in sound insulation cal-
culations.
metadata.original_text: Work at the building should be stopped when measuring.

results.window:
D2m = L1.2m – L2
L1.2m is the average outdoor sound pressure level at a distance of 2 m in front of the façade, and L2 is the
energy-average sound pressure level in a room.
 D2m,nT = D2m + 10log(T/T0)
D2m is the level difference, T is the reverberation in the receiving room, and T0 is the reference reverberation
l Apparent sound reduction index
R'45° = L1,s – L2 + 10log(S/A) – 1.5 dB
L1,s is the average outdoor sound pressure level on the test surface, and L2 is the energy-average sound pressure
level in a room.  S is the area of the test specimen, and A is the equivalent absorption area of the receiving room
Measurements in the field are performed in situ on partitions of buildings.  The results are used to document con-
formance to building regulations and design criteria.  In field measurements, sound and vibration propagate not just via
the partition under investigation, but also via other partitions, structures and leaks.  This propagation is called ‘flanking’
Measurements in the laboratory are made on building elements such as wall panels or windows mounted in special test
rooms, designed and tested to prevent ‘flanking’.  The measurements follow uniform and strict procedures, and the
measuring equipment is usually permanently installed.
results.original_text:
The results are used to document con-
formance to building regulations and design criteria.

query: I need a solution for covering Frequency analysis, reverberation time and standards compliance.

results.window:
For this
reason, the Measurement assistant setting is enabled only when Planned measurement is set to On.
 l Reuse B2 measurements = Off
l Reuse T2 measurements = Automatic (default)
It is highly unlikely that the amount of acoustical absorption in the receiving room will change during your sur-
vey, so it is generally safe to automatically reuse T2 measurements.
 l Reuse L1 measurements = Off (default)
To enable settings for low-frequency measurements in the Measurement plan group of settings:
l Standard = ISO 16283
l Bottom frequency = 50 Hz
To enable low-frequency measurements (B2 LF, L2 LF and L1 LF) in the Measurement order setting at least one partition
with a room (source or receiving) with a volume less than 25 m3 must be set up in the project.
 Low-frequency reverberation time measurements are measured simultaneously with normal reverberation time meas-
urements, so there are no settings specific to low-frequency reverberation time measurements.
 l Planned measurement = Enabled
l Measurement order = B2, B2 LF, L2 LF, L2, L1, L1 LF, T2
T2 includes low-frequency and normal reverberation time measurements.
 You can set the measurement plan for your room background noise tests in the Room background noise setup group of
See Room background noise for more information.
 l Planned measurement = Enabled
l B2: No.

Accurate noise measurement, analysis and reporting has never been more simple.

 This sound level meter platform houses the solution that gets your job done faster and easier.  Controlled via smart-device apps tailored to your task, get your work done with confidence.

 This solution is all you need to easily conduct and report on environmental noise surveys to ensure regulations compliance and investigate noise complaints.

query: I need to measure a residential building and I need to follow the standard ISO 3382. Which solution should I use?

results.window:
We haved moved ${referer} to
www.hbkworld.com
This will bring together HBM, Brüel & Kjær, nCode, ReliaSoft, MicroStrain and Discom brands, helping you innovate faster for a cleaner, healthier, and more productive world.

 The loudspeaker weighs less than 8 kg and is fitted with a convenient lifting handle that does not measurably interfere with the sound field.

 For most architectural acoustics measurements, the OmniPower sound source radiates sound evenly in all directions and gives reproducible and reliable results.  The relevant architectural acoustics measurements standards (ISO 16283, ISO 10140 and ISO 3382) require the use of an omnidirectional sound source.

 Background noise is the enemy of good architectural acoustics measurements particularly at low frequencies where traffic noise and air conditioning systems are some of the main culprits i.e.  between 100 Hz and 200 Hz.The OmniPower sound source is designed to deliver its peak performance in this very same range delivering maximum power where it’s needed most.

 This will bring together HBM, Brüel & Kjær, nCode, ReliaSoft, and Discom brands, helping you innovate faster for a cleaner, healthier, and more productive world.
results.original_text: The relevant architectural acoustics measurements standards (ISO 16283, ISO 10140 and ISO 3382) require the use of an omnidirectional sound source.

l Floor/Level: The storey of the building in which the room lies.
 l Volume: The volume of the room.

 You can choose any room that has been added to the project or None if you do not want to specify a single room
from which to reuse measurements.  See Measurement reuse for more information.
 l Background noise: Adds a room background noise test for the room.

results.window:
l Off: Measurements will not be reused.  L1, B2 and T2 shall be measured for each partition (as applicable).
 Default: Reuse L1 measurements = Off.
 l Rooms > Room X > Reuse measurements from
The Reuse measurements from setting allows you to specify from which room you want to reuse measurements.
 This setting can be useful in large surveys which contain many rooms.  You can choose any room that has been
added to the project or None if you do not want to specify a single room.
 ✐Note: Keep the setting in mind when you choose the order in which to test the partitions.

query: I need to perform sound power measurements with a multi channel setup. Which solution should I use?

results.window:
DIRAC is a valuable acoustics measurement tool for field and laboratory acoustics engineers, researchers and educational institutions.  Users can compare the acoustics of one room with another, validate sound systems and perform scale model measurements.Based on the measurement and analysis of impulse responses, the tool supports a variety of measurement configurations.

 DIRAC supports wireless room acoustics measurements when connected toHBK 2255 Sound Level Meteras a wireless microphone, and/orHBK 2755 Smart Power Amplifieras a wireless sound source.  Multi-channel measurements can be made using multiple HBK 2255’s, or with most Windows compatible multi-channel sound devices.

 Speech intelligibility measurements can be carried out in compliance with the IEC 60268-16 standard, for male and female voices, through an artificial mouth-directional loudspeaker sound source or through direct injection into a sound system, taking into account the impact of background noise.

 In combination with Echo Speech Source Type 4720, speech intelligibility measurements can be performed quickly and easily.  The Echo delivers a calibrated signal that is used by DIRAC to calculate different speech intelligibility parameters.
results.original_text: Multi-channel measurements can be made using multiple HBK 2255’s, or with most Windows compatible multi-channel sound devices.

query: I want a solution with a simple interface and affordabe.

results.window:
Automatic measurement transfer via network or USB to storage media for backup and analysis including NAS.  The B&K 2245 is designed from the ground up to support both in IOS and Android apps.  This enables us to add new features and updates without the need to update the sound level meter.

 The PC software is simple to install and use.  Data is quickly and easily transferred to your PC and organized intuitively, ready for analysis and reporting, using preconfigured, user-friendly tools.

 * Available measurement features depend on installed software licenses.  Refer to product data sheet for details.
results.original_text: The PC software is simple to install and use.

results.window:
Made Smarter
Automatic measurement transfer via network or USB to storage media for backup and analysis including NAS.  The B&K 2245 is designed from the ground up to support both in IOS and Android apps.  This enables us to add new features and updates without the need to update the sound level meter.
 Made Faster
The PC software is simple to install and use.  Data is quickly and easily transferred to your PC and organized intuitively, ready for analysis and reporting, using preconfigured, user-friendly tools.

 CHARACTERISTICS
Single measurement range: 23.2 – 140.3 dB from the noise floor to maximum level,
A-weighted
Integrated GPS for time and location
Ergonomic design for comfortable single-handed operation
Colour LCD with a bright, clean layout that clearly displays measured level and measurement status
Measurement status light-ring visible from any angle
Built-in Li-Ion battery, typically providing more than 13 hours operation with Wi-Fi enabled
16 GB built-in storage for measurements and annotations
Integrated Wi-Fi and Bluetooth® Low Energy for connection to mobile and PC apps
MEASUREMENT CAPABILITIES
IEC 61672-1 class 1 sound level meter
Broadband level measurements with two simultaneous frequency weightings
1/1- and/or 1/3-octave band frequency analysis for one frequency weighting
Logging of all parameters at intervals between 1 second and 1 minute
Broadband and spectral statistics for 5 percentiles.  Full level distribution stored allowing re-calculation of arbitrary percentiles in HBK apps.
results.original_text:
Made Faster
The PC software is simple to install and use.

query: Which solutions gives basic logging and a simple interface?

results.window:
The instrument can log broadband parameters as well as spectrum parameters.
 l Disabled: Turn off Logging mode.
 l Enabled: Turn on Logging mode.
 The Logging interval setting controls the length of the interval at which measurements are logged.
 To enable the setting: Logging mode = Enabled.
 This setting controls how the measurement stops: automatically or manually.
 l Preset: The instrument measures for the time specified in Preset time, then stops and saves automatically.
results.original_text: The Logging interval setting controls the length of the interval at which measurements are logged.

metadata.window:
The instrument can log broadband parameters as well as spectrum parameters.
 l Disabled: Turn off Logging mode.
 l Enabled: Turn on Logging mode.
 The Logging interval setting controls the length of the interval at which measurements are logged.
 To enable the setting: Logging mode = Enabled.
 This setting controls how the measurement stops: automatically or manually.
 l Preset: The instrument measures for the time specified in Preset time, then stops and saves automatically.
metadata.original_text: The Logging interval setting controls the length of the interval at which measurements are logged.

results.window:
l Rising: Creates selections that only contain levels above the defined level.  Rising is the default setting.
 l Falling: Creates selections that only contain levels below the defined level.
 Enviro Noise Partner can perform two types of impulse searches: Simple impulse and Fast logging impulsivity.
 A simple impulse search looks at the difference between two parameters, one of which is expected to respond to
impulsive noise more than the other, resulting in a larger difference when impulses are present.
 l Spain – RD 1367: Search for instances where LAIeq – LAeq > 10 dB (+3 dB penalty) or 15 dB (+6 dB penalty).
 l Germany – TA Laerm: Search for LAFTeq – LAeq, no set criterion.
results.original_text: Enviro Noise Partner can perform two types of impulse searches: Simple impulse and Fast logging impulsivity.
